pageContext.description: A broad, thin, flat dagger, much oxidized, with 9 rivets and blade, all present. Part of hilt, which is partly of wood.
pageContext.other: After Riveted Dagger, written in pencil  may have been "(Wessex I)"
pageContext.associations: Found resting on a human skull
pageContext.publications: Translations of the Leicestershire Literary & Philosophical Society ix (1888) pp. 27, 28., Harrison W.J. Geology of Leichester + Rutland, p.  51., Evans, Ancient Bronze Implements, 231, Fig.  288.
pageContext.collection: Leicestershire Museum, given by Mr. J. Mr. George Harrison
pageContext.remarks: It was found 23 April 1868, about 2 feet deep,resting on a grave, in Sidney Street, Leichester, about 7 feet from the edge of the foot road leading to Belgrave.
